instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Air bad screen - or...??
threads.message: This is replacement screen on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A. Half the screen image is dim. Did I get a bad screen? O'scope image is of <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL>-6. Of all remaining pins - only <SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SCL_R</SIGNAL> = 3.3 VDC. backlight is 24.66 VDC.

threads.title: Macbook Air bad screen - or...??
threads.message: Very very likely a bad LCD

threads.title: Macbook Air bad screen - or...??
threads.message:
If all 6 return lines give the same signal, then could be the screen.

"Of all remaining pins - only <SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SCL_R</SIGNAL> = 3.3 VDC"
I don't really what you mean to say.
SCL/SDA lines should both have 3V.
If not, check <RESISTOR>R8361</RESISTOR>-64 and diode mode to ground.

threads.title: Macbook Air bad screen - or...??
threads.message: Thanks for that response! I meant those were the only voltages present on connector aside from backlight. I hope this helps others.
